item.title: Fuel Crossfeed Valves – Fuel Crossfeed Valves 2 and 3

numlitem.para: All main tank fuel quantity indicating systems are operating, and
Center tank and auxiliary tank (if installed) remain empty, or fuel is included a part of Zero Fuel Weight, and

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
The EICAS Fuel Synoptic crossfeed valve position display will be blank for all four crossfeed valves (i.e. low intensity white with no fuel flow bars).

numlitem.para: CWT fuel, if carried, must be included as part of ZFW. Fuel may be included as part of ZFW in any quantity up to the maximum ZFW or the capacity of CWT.

note.para: CWT fuel included as part of ZFW may be used en route.
Takeoff fuel feed must be main tank-to-engine or main tanks 2 and 3 to all engines.

numlitem.para: If fuel is present in the center wing tank, center wing tank override/jettison pumps must be selected OFF for takeoff.
Condition #2: Center Wing Tank fuel must be included as part of the ZFW but is considered usable en route.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected crossfeed switch: "___ FUEL XFEED VL LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Secure the affected valve open as follows:
Access front wing spar. (Access for No. 2 or No. 3 crossfeed valves between inboard and outboard engines.)
Open the circuit breaker associated with the inoperative crossfeed valve and install DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier:
For crossfeed valve 2, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 2 circuit breaker.
For crossfeed valve 3, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 3 circuit breaker.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected valve (AMM 28-22-02/401).
Position manual override lever for affected valve in the OPEN position and lockwire.
Remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier and close the circuit breaker opened above.
